sen.j: 北条 氏邦／藤田 氏邦（ほうじょう うじくに／ふじた うじくに）は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Ujikuni HOJO (alternatively Ujikuni FUJITA) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
Ujikuni HOJO (alternatively Ujikuni FUJITA) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: Sengoku periodの補足追加しました。
sen.e: Ujikuni HOJO (alternatively Ujikuni FUJITA) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

sen.j: 北条氏康の四男。
sen.e: He was the fourth son of Ujiyasu HOJO.
He was the fourth son of Ujiyasu HOJO.
He was the fourth son of Ujiyasu HOJO.

sen.j: 北条氏政、北条氏照の弟。
sen.e: He was a younger brother of Ujimasa HOJO and Ujiteru HOJO.
He was a younger brother of Ujimasa HOJO and Ujiteru HOJO.
He was a younger brother of Ujimasa HOJO and Ujiteru HOJO.

sen.j: 藤田康邦の娘婿となり家督を継いだ。
sen.e: He became an adopted son-in-low of Yasukuni FUJITA to inherit reigns of the family.
He became an adopted son-in-low of Yasukuni FUJITA to inherit reigns of the family.
He became an adopted son-in-low of Yasukuni FUJITA to inherit reigns of the family.

sen.j: 藤田安房守（藤田氏邦）を名乗った。
sen.e: He announced himself as Fujita Awa no kami (Ujikuni FUJITA).
He announced himself as Fujita Awa no kami (Ujikuni FUJITA).
He announced himself as Fujita Awa no kami (Ujikuni FUJITA).

sen.j: 北条氏邦を自称した記録は未発見。
sen.e: No record has been found in which he proclaimed himself as Ujikuni HOJO.
No record has been found in which he proclaimed himself as Ujikuni HOJO.
No record has been found in which he proclaimed himself as Ujikuni HOJO.

sen.j: 官職：安房守。
sen.e: His job grade was Awa no kami (Governor of Awa Province).
His job grade was Awa no kami (Governor of Awa Province).
His job grade was Awa no kami (Governor of Awa Province).

sen.j: 生年には異説もある。
sen.e: There are different theories regarding his birthday.
There are different theories regarding his birthday.
There are different theories regarding his birthday.

sen.j: 子どもに東国丸、亀丸、光福丸、采女がいたがうち東国丸が短命で二人が幼かった。
sen.e: Ujikuni had four children, Togokumaru, Kamemaru, Kofukumaru and Uneme; Togokumaru died at an early age, and the two of them was still in their childhood.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ujikuni had four children, Togokumaru, Kamemaru, Kofukumaru and Uneme; Togokumaru died at an early age, and the two of them was still in their childhood.
Ujikuni had four children, Togokumaru, Kamemaru, Kofukumaru and Uneme; Togokumaru died at an early age, and the two of them was still in their childhood.

sen.j: このため、兄氏政より６男の北条直定（北条氏定とも）を養子として迎えている。
sen.e: Therefore, he adopted Naosada HOJO (or Ujisada HOJO), the sixth son of his elder brother Ujimasa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, he adopted Naosada HOJO (or Ujisada HOJO), the sixth son of his older brother Ujimasa.
sen.cmt: 統一リストより、elder brother→older brotherに修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, he adopted Naosada HOJO (or Ujisada HOJO), the sixth son of his older brother Ujimasa.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 兄・氏照同様に武勇・統治に優れ、北関東の最前線、上野国方面の軍事を任された。
sen.e: Thanks to his excellence at military prowess and governance like his elder brother Ujiteru, he was put in charge of military affairs for Kozuke Province that was the forefront of northern Kanto area.
Thanks to his excellence at military prowess and governance like his older brother Ujiteru, he was put in charge of military affairs for Kozuke Province that was the forefront of northern Kanto area.
sen.cmt: 統一リストより、elder brother→older brotherに修正しました。
sen.e: Thanks to his excellence at military prowess and governance like his older brother Ujiteru, he was put in charge of military affairs for Kozuke Province that was the forefront of northern Kanto area.

sen.j: 武田信玄との三増峠の戦いをはじめ各地を転戦し、いくつもの武功を挙げた。
sen.e: He moved from place to place for fight including the Battle of Mimasetoge against Shingen TAKEDA, and accomplished several military exploits.
He moved from place to place for fight including the Battle of Mimasetoge against Shingen TAKEDA, and accomplished several military exploits.
He moved from place to place for fight including the Battle of Mimasetoge against Shingen TAKEDA, and accomplished several military exploits.

sen.j: また、領土拡大に大きく貢献した。
sen.e: Also, he remarkably contributed to the expansion of the territory.
Also, he remarkably contributed to the expansion of the territory.
Also, he remarkably contributed to the expansion of the territory.

sen.j: 本能寺の変後の神流川の戦いでは、当主の氏直を補佐し滝川一益を壊走させている。
sen.e: In the Battle of Kanna River after the Honnoji Incident, he assisted the family head Ujinao and put Kazumasu TAKIGAWA to rout.
In the Battle of Kanna-gawa River after the Honno-ji Incident, he assisted the family head Ujinao and put Kazumasu TAKIGAWA to rout.
In the Battle of Kanna-gawa River after the Honno-ji Incident, he assisted the family head Ujinao and put Kazumasu TAKIGAWA to rout.

sen.j: 短慮により北条氏の滅亡のきっかけとなったと言われる名胡桃事変の当事者（沼田城代猪俣邦憲の指揮官）であった。
sen.e: Ujikuni was a person concerned with Nagurumi Incident (he was a commander of Kuninori INOMATA who was a keeper of Numata-jo Castle) that lead to the fall of Hojo clan due to his indiscreetness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ujikuni was a person concerned with the Nagurumi Incident (he was a commander of Kuninori INOMATA who was a keeper of Numata-jo Castle) that led to the fall of the Hojo clan due to his indiscreetness.
sen.cmt: the Nagurumi Incident、the Hojo clanとし、lead→ledに修正しました。
sen.e: Ujikuni was a person concerned with the Nagurumi Incident (he was a commander of Kuninori INOMATA who was a keeper of Numata-jo Castle) that led to the fall of the Hojo clan due to his indiscreetness.

sen.j: 家督を継いだ藤田家の一族を謀殺したことなどにより激しやすい性格と見なされることもある。
sen.e: His character is sometimes regarded as impulsive due to the fact that he premeditatedly murdered the member of Fujita family of which he inherited the reigns.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His character is sometimes regarded as impulsive due to the fact that he premeditatedly murdered the member of the Fujita family of which he inherited the reigns.
His character is sometimes regarded as impulsive due to the fact that he premeditatedly murdered the member of the Fujita family of which he inherited the reigns.

sen.j: また義弟にあたる藤田信吉は武田勝頼、上杉景勝に仕え、北条と敵対することになる。
sen.e: Ujikuni's younger brother-in-law Nobuyoshi FUJITA served Katsuyori TAKEDA and Kagekatsu UESUGI to become hostile to Hojo clan.
Ujikuni's younger brother-in-law Nobuyoshi FUJITA served Katsuyori TAKEDA and Kagekatsu UESUGI to become hostile to the Hojo clan.
Ujikuni's younger brother-in-law Nobuyoshi FUJITA served Katsuyori TAKEDA and Kagekatsu UESUGI to become hostile to the Hojo clan.

sen.j: 天正6年（1578年）5月、上杉氏の家督争いである御館の乱が起こると弟上杉景虎の援軍要請に応じた兄氏政の名代として、氏照とともに景虎支援のために越後に出陣。
sen.e: When Otate War which is a succession dispute of Uesugi clan broke out in May 1578, Ujikuni departed for the front of Echigo together with Ujiteru to assist Kagetora UESUGI as a representative of his elder brother Ujimasa who responded to the requirement of reinforcement by a younger brother Kagetora.

When the Otate War which was a succession dispute of the Uesugi clan broke out in June 1578, Ujikuni departed for the front of Echigo together with Ujiteru to assist Kagetora UESUGI as a representative of his older brother Ujimasa who responded to the requirement of reinforcement by a younger brother Kagetora.
sen.cmt: the Otate War、the Usesugi clanとし、is→was、elder brother→older brotherに修正、旧暦→新暦に修正しました。
sen.e: When the Otate War which was a succession dispute of the Uesugi clan broke out in June 1578, Ujikuni departed for the front of Echigo together with Ujiteru to assist Kagetora UESUGI as a representative of his older brother Ujimasa who responded to the requirement of reinforcement by a younger brother Kagetora.

sen.j: 天正18年（1590年）、豊臣秀吉の小田原の役の際には小田原城に籠もることに反対して大規模な野戦を主張した。
sen.e: In the Siege of Odawara by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1590, Ujikuni insisted large-scale open battle, opposing to keep to Odawara-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Siege of Odawara by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1590, Ujikuni insisted large-scale open battle, opposing to keep to Odawara-jo Castle.
In the Siege of Odawara by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1590, Ujikuni insisted large-scale open battle, opposing to keep to Odawara-jo Castle.

sen.j: だが容れられず、居城・鉢形城に籠もって抗戦する。
sen.e: However, his claim was not accepted; he resisted keeping to his residential castle, Hachigata-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処鉢形城：http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%89%A2%E5%BD%A2%E5%9F%8E
sen.e: However, his claim was not accepted; he resisted keeping to his residential castle, Hachigata-jo Castle.
However, his claim was not accepted; he resisted keeping to his residential castle, Hachigata-jo Castle.

sen.j: しかし前田利家等の率いる大軍に攻められて降伏する。
sen.e: Nevertheless, he surrendered being offended by a vast army led by Toshiie MAEDA and the like.
Nevertheless, he surrendered being offended by a vast army led by Toshiie MAEDA and the like.
Nevertheless, he surrendered being offended by a vast army led by Toshiie MAEDA and the like.

sen.j: 戦後は利家の助命嘆願で、剃髪することで一命を許され、能登国津向（今の七尾）知行1000石を得た。
sen.e: After the Siege of Odawara, he escaped death on the condition of taking the tonsure thanks to the plea for sparing a life by Toshiie; he obtained enfeoffment of 1000 koku in Tsumugi, Noto Province (current Nanao).

After the Siege of Odawara, he escaped death on the condition of taking the tonsure thanks to the plea for sparing a life by Toshiie; he obtained enfeoffment of 1000 koku in Tsumugi, Noto Province (current Nanao).

After the Siege of Odawara, he escaped death on the condition of taking the tonsure thanks to the plea for sparing a life by Toshiie; he obtained enfeoffment of 1000 koku in Tsumugi, Noto Province (current Nanao).

sen.j: 慶長2年（1597年）、加賀国金沢市にて57歳で病没した。
sen.e: In 1597, he died of illness at the age of 57 in Kanazawa, Kaga Province.
sen.cmt: 原文「金沢市」は金沢の間違い？
sen.e: In 1597, he died of illness at the age of 57 in Kanazawa, Kaga Province.
In 1597, he died of illness at the age of 57 in Kanazawa, Kaga Province.

sen.j: 金沢で荼毘に付された後に、遺骸は武蔵正龍寺に移された。
sen.e: After the cremation of his body in Kanazawa, his remains was transferred to Shoryu-ji Temple in Musashi Province.
After the cremation of his body in Kanazawa, his remains were transferred to Shoryu-ji Temple in Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: his remains was→his remains wereに修正しました。
sen.e: After the cremation of his body in Kanazawa, his remains were transferred to Shoryu-ji Temple in Musashi Province.

sen.j: その時の大法要に集まった参列者はひと山越える長さに及んだといわれ、かつての威勢と人望を偲ばせた。
sen.e: At that time, the line formed by the attendants assembled to the great Buddhist memorial service was so long that it crossed a mountain; that reminded Ujikuni's power and popularity in life.

At that time, the line formed by the attendants assembled to the great Buddhist memorial service was so long that it crossed a mountain; that reminded people of Ujikuni's power and popularity in life.
sen.cmt: reminded Ujikuni's power and popularity→reminded people of Ujikuni's power and popularityとしました。
sen.e: At that time, the line formed by the attendants assembled to the great Buddhist memorial service was so long that it crossed a mountain; that reminded people of Ujikuni's power and popularity in life.

sen.j: 妻の大福御前は鉢形に残った。
sen.e: Ujikuni's wife Daifuku Gozen remained in Hachigata.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ujikuni's wife Daifuku Gozen remained in Hachigata.
Ujikuni's wife Daifuku Gozen remained in Hachigata.

sen.j: 1593年6月9日（文禄2年5月10日 (旧暦)）に病死したとも、自害したとも言われている。
sen.e: It is said she died from a disease or killed herself in June 9, 1593.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said she died from a disease or killed herself on June 9, 1593.
It is said she died from a disease or killed herself on June 9, 1593.

sen.j: その跡は京都紫野大徳寺で喝食となっていた氏邦の末子が還俗して庄三郎と称し、氏邦の知行を相続した。
sen.e: Ujikuni's youngest son who was a Kasshiki (postulant) at Daitoku-ji Temple at Kyoto Murasakino returned to secular life and referred to himself as Shozaburo to inherit enfeoffment of Ujikuni.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ujikuni's youngest son who was a Kasshiki (postulant) at Daitoku-ji Temple in Murasakino, Kyoto returned to secular life and referred to himself as Shozaburo to inherit enfeoffment of Ujikuni.
sen.cmt: at Kyoto Murasakino→in Murasakino, Kyotoとしました。
sen.e: Ujikuni's youngest son who was a Kasshiki (postulant) at Daitoku-ji Temple in Murasakino, Kyoto returned to secular life and referred to himself as Shozaburo to inherit enfeoffment of Ujikuni.

sen.j: その後、前田家臣で前田家縁戚でもある前田利益の娘を妻とした。
sen.e: Then, Shozaburo took a daughter of Toshimasu MAEDA who was a vassal and a relative of Maeda family as his wife.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, Shozaburo took a daughter of Toshimasu MAEDA who was a vassal and a relative of the Maeda family as his wife.
Then, Shozaburo took a daughter of Toshimasu MAEDA who was a vassal and a relative of the Maeda family as his wife.

sen.j: その子主殿助の後、嗣子がなく絶家となった。
sen.e: After his son Tomonosuke, there was no heir and the family became extinct.
After his son Tomonosuke, there was no heir and the family became extinct.
After his son Tomonosuke, there was no heir and the family became extinct.

sen.j: 養子直定は小田原開城後、義父らと共に高野山にて蟄居する。
sen.e: Ujikuni's adopted son Naosada was confined to Mt. Koya together with his father-in-law and the like after the surrender of Odawara-jo Castle to the enemy.
Ujikuni's adopted son Naosada was confined to Mt. Koya together with his father-in-law and the like after the surrender of Odawara-jo Castle to the enemy.
Ujikuni's adopted son Naosada was confined to Mt. Koya together with his father-in-law and the like after the surrender of Odawara-jo Castle to the enemy.

sen.j: その後徳川家康に仕えた。
sen.e: After the confinement, Naosada served to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the confinement, Naosada served to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
After the confinement, Naosada served to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: のち紀州徳川家に家臣として付された。
sen.e: Then he was appointed to a vassal of Kishu (Kii Province) Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then he was appointed to a vassal of the Kishu (Kii Province) Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: the Kishu (Kii Province) Tokugawa familyとしました。
sen.e: Then he was appointed to a vassal of the Kishu (Kii Province) Tokugawa family.

sen.j: その子北条氏時より紀州徳川家に仕えた。
sen.e: From the period of Naosada's is son Ujitoki HOJO, the family had served to Kishu Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the period of Naosada's son Ujitoki HOJO, the family had served to the Kishu Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: Naosada's is son→Naosada's sonに修正、the Kishu Tokugawa familyとしました。
sen.e: From the period of Naosada's son Ujitoki HOJO, the family had served to the Kishu Tokugawa family.

sen.j: 氏時の子氏常、養子氏成、氏賢まで確認できる。
sen.e: Ujitoki's son Ujitsune, his adopted son Ujinari and 氏賢 can be identified.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処読み方不明
sen.e: Ujitoki's son Ujitsune, his adopted son Ujinari and 氏賢 can be identified.
Ujitoki's son Ujitsune, his adopted son Ujinari and 氏賢 can be identified.

sen.j: 武人としての名声に加えて、養蚕、林業などの殖産にも熱意を燃やし、大きな業績を残した。
sen.e: In addition to Ujikuni's fame as a warrior, he was eager to activate industries such as sericulture and forestry, and left significant achievements.
In addition to Ujikuni's fame as a warrior, he was eager to activate industries such as sericulture and forestry, and left significant achievements.
In addition to Ujikuni's fame as a warrior, he was eager to activate industries such as sericulture and forestry, and left significant achievements.

sen.j: この時代農業を除くと、生糸こそ日本の主要産業であった。
sen.e: In this era, a key industry of Japan except agriculture was a production of raw silk thread.
In this era, a key industry of Japan except agriculture was a production of raw silk thread.
In this era, a key industry of Japan except agriculture was a production of raw silk thread.

sen.j: 氏邦は養蚕を北武蔵、上野の主要産業とすべく尽力し、生糸の一大拠点を築き上げた。
sen.e: Ujikuni exerted himself to make sericulture a key industry in northern Musashi Province and Kozuke Province, and built up a major foothold of raw silk thread production.
Ujikuni exerted himself to make sericulture a key industry in northern Musashi Province and Kozuke Province, and built up a major foothold of raw silk thread production.
Ujikuni exerted himself to make sericulture a key industry in northern Musashi Province and Kozuke Province, and built up a major foothold of raw silk thread production.

sen.j: 鉢形城歴史館にて、往事の業績が偲ばれる。
sen.e: His achievements in the past can be commemorated in Hachigata-jo Castle History Museum.
His achievements in the past can be commemorated in Hachigata-jo Castle History Museum.
His achievements in the past can be commemorated in Hachigata-jo Castle History Museum.
